dmca.title: Notice and Takedown Request
dmca.body:
NC 

-----Original Message-----
From: James T. Swanson [mailto:jts@bdplaw.com] 
Sent: Friday, May 06, 2005 6:28 PM
To: copyright@theplanet.com; abuse@theplanet.com
Subject: Notice and Takedown Request
Importance: High

ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. 
1333 North Stemmons Freeway, Suite 110
Dallas, Texas 75207  

To:         Lance Crosby, Esq., Chief Operating Officer, Designated Agent for
the Purposes of Title 17, Section 112, USC, via email to
copyright@theplanet.com and to abuse@theplanet.com
Dear Mr. Crosby:
Re:         Our client Jennings Capital Inc., www.jenningscapital.com, (the
"Client Site"), 
                Jennings Securities, www.jenningssecurities.com (the
"Offending Site")
                Copyright Infringement, Trade-mark Infringement, Passing Off
and Unfair Competition

Please be advised that we are legal counsel to Jennings Capital Inc., the
full mailing address of which is 430, 520 - 5th Avenue S.W., Calgary,
Alberta Canada T2P 3R7, with respect to this matter.  As legal counsel, we
are authorized to provide the notices and requests contained herein.
We understand that the Offending Site is hosted on your systems.
We further understand that your Mr. Eric Sims has previously and recently
been contacted by telephone with respect to this matter so that your
organization is now fully aware of the issues between the two websites in
question. Our client has owned and operated the Client Site on the web with
essentially its present look and feel since 2001, which you can readily
verify by viewing archived versions at www.archive.com via its
"WayBackMachine".  The Offending Site is under a domain name registered only
in October of last year and there currently are no archived versions of it
on archive.org.  It is therefore clear that the Client Site has existed in
substantially its present form for a number of years prior to the Offending
Site coming on line.
The Offending Site contains images copied from the Client Site, including
images located at http://www.jenningscapital.com/images/jenningslogo.gif and
http://www.jenningscapital.com/mainimages/ctrbottom.jpg.
Those images are subject to copyright under both Canadian and U.S. law
(including the DMCA), and various international treaties. This copying, and
resultant public display, distribution and publication have all occurred
without authorization from our client.  As a result, the Offending Site
infringes our client's copyrights and other intellectual property rights in
valuable, unique, original and proprietary works.  
The Offending Site also misappropriates and infringes our client's valuable
intellectual property in its trademarks, service marks, trading names and
goodwill, specifically including the trademark and trade name "Jennings",
and the slogan and design "Communication | Trust | Results" (including the
associated image described above). This constitutes trademark infringement,
trademark dilution and passing off under both the common law and applicable
statutes and legislation.   
Further, the Offending Site also copies and mimics the structure, as well as
the look and feel, of the Client Site in a calculated manner with an obvious
intent to interfere with our client's business operations on the Internet.
We are advised by our client that it has a good faith belief that there is
no legal basis for use by the owners or operators of the Offending Site of
the foregoing materials.
We would also point out that setting up a confusingly similar site is
commonly a precursor to other illegal conduct, including but not limited to
phishing, pharming, fraud and other malicious and unlawful matters. Our
client requires your assistance in avoiding the consequences of any such
actions.
We are confident that you will agree that upon provision to you of notice of
the above, you are obligated to and will immediately proceed to take down
the Offending Site and remove access to it via your systems.  Please treat
this as our formal request that you do so.
In addition to the foregoing, please treat this as our formal notice and
request that you archive and preserve for further access, should we wish to
exercise same, of copies of all data, information, computer files,
documents, records, logs and any other materials related to the Offending
Site, or the ownership or operation thereof, and any and all access,
uploads, downloads and ftp access thereto or therefrom.  
Courts in the U.S. and Canada have made it clear that all information
available on electronic storage media is discoverable, whether readily
readable ("active") or "deleted" but recoverable.   In addition, it is clear
that permitting or failing to take steps to avoid the destruction of
evidence that is relevant with respect to potential litigation constitutes
the tort of spoliation. We trust that you will therefore take all steps
necessary to preserve all potentially relevant evidence with respect to this
matter and ask that you confirm by return that you have done so.
Finally, please provide us immediately with particulars as to the name,
address and contact information of the individual or individuals operating
the Offending Site.  If you are unable or unwilling to do so without a court
order, please advise immediately.
Please confirm by return that you will accede to the foregoing requests.
Thank you for your anticipated cooperation.  We look forward to hearing from
you and to seeing the Offending Site taken down so that it is no longer
accessible from the Internet.  We will be monitoring the status of the
Offending Site.
Yours truly,

JAMES T. SWANSON
Lawyer/Trade-mark Agent
Burnet, Duckworth & Palmer LLP
1400, 350 - 7th Ave SW
Calgary, Alberta T2P 3N9
Tel. 403-260-5712 (direct line) Fax. 403-260-0332 www.bdplaw.com

LEGAL NOTICE: The information contained in this email (including any
attachments) is (a) confidential, proprietary and subject to copyright, and
may be subject to solicitor/client privilege, all such rights being reserved
and not waived, and (b) intended only for the use of the individual or
entity named as recipient(s).  Disclosing, forwarding, copying or retaining
this message by anyone other than the intended recipient(s), or an
authorized agent, is prohibited. If you have received this communication in
error, please notify us immediately by return email or telephone and delete
all copies of the original message.  Any legal opinion expressed is pursuant
to the laws of the Province of Alberta, Canada, at the time. Thank you.
